title:
CREATE TABLE mytable
(
  id              int unsigned NOT NULL auto_increment,
  username        varchar(100) NOT NULL,
  email           varchar(100) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY     (id)
);

(
  id              int unsigned NOT NULL auto_increment,
  username        varchar(100) NOT NULL,
  email           varchar(100) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY     (id)
);

title: First, you need to create a user and then give the user permissions on certain databases/tables. While creating the user, you also need to specify where this user can connect from.

inline_content.Text: First, you need to create a user and then give the user permissions on certain databases/tables. While creating the user, you also need to specify where this user can connect from.

title: Will create a user that can only connect on the local machine where the database is hosted.

inline_content.Text: Will create a user that can only connect on the local machine where the database is hosted.

title: Will create a user that can connect from anywhere (except the local machine).

inline_content.Text: Will create a user that can connect from anywhere (except the local machine).

title: Grant common, basic privileges to the user for all tables of the specified database:

inline_content.Text: Grant common, basic privileges to the user for all tables of the specified database:

title: GRANT SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE ON databaseName.* TO 'userName'@'localhost';

content_resolved.code: GRANT SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE ON databaseName.* TO 'userName'@'localhost';

title: Grant all privileges to the user for all tables on all databases (attention with this):

inline_content.Text: Grant all privileges to the user for all tables on all databases (attention with this):

title: GRANT ALL ON *.* TO 'userName'@'localhost' WITH GRANT OPTION;

content_resolved.code: GRANT ALL ON *.* TO 'userName'@'localhost' WITH GRANT OPTION;

title: As demonstrated above,
c
targets all databases and tables,
databaseName.*
c
targets all tables of the specific database. It is also possible to specify database and table like so
databaseName.tableName
